snippet: The Supreme Court of India ordered the federal authorities to take over a probe into a testing scandal in the state of Madhya Pradesh that has involved numerous arrests and possibly deaths.
abstract: Indian Supreme Court orders federal investigators to take over inquiry of two-year-old testing scandal in Madhya Pradesh state; ruling is response to whistle-blowers and opposition politicians accusing Madhya Pradesh government, led by Prime Min Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party, of half-hearted probe.

byline.original: By NIDA NAJAR and SUHASINI RAJ

lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court of India ordered the federal authorities to take over a probe into a testing scandal in the state of Madhya Pradesh that has involved numerous arrests and possibly deaths.

headline.main: India Inquiry Into Scandal Over Testing Set to Expand
headline.print_headline: India Inquiry Into Scandal Over Testing Set to Expand
